TITLE: 4th person dies from gunfire at Mississippi New Year's party
SUMMARY: Authorities say a fourth person has died after several people pulled out weapons and fired more than 50 bullets at a New Year’s Eve party in Mississippi

SUMMARY: Colorado search teams are looking for two missing people in the smoldering debris from a massive wildfire while people who escaped the flames are sorting through what didn't burn

SUMMARY: The former cop gets to fight his conviction in the death of his third wife.

SUMMARY: Investigators are still trying to determine how the fire began.

SUMMARY: A line of severe storms damaged homes, knocked out power and downed trees.

SUMMARY: Officials say a man began firing at deputies after a family dispute.

SUMMARY: One person was arrested after the vehicle was found and more were arrested later

SUMMARY: The winter that took its time getting to the Midwest has begun to finally arrive on the first day of the new year

TITLE: Colorado fire victims begin new year surveying destruction
SUMMARY: A wind-whipped wildfire tore through the Denver suburbs.

SUMMARY: A judge rejected Prince Andrew's attempt to block the progression of a lawsuit.

SUMMARY: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear has declared a state of emergency after a powerful powerful storm caused flash floods, power outages and property damage, including from a possible tornado, on Saturday

SUMMARY: Investigators say three people were killed and four others wounded after several people at a Mississippi party started shooting just minutes before the end of 2021

SUMMARY: Officials: Nearly 1,000 homes destroyed, hundreds damaged in Colorado wildfire; 3 people missing

SUMMARY: Authorities say a New York City police officer's skull was broken when he was shot New Year's morning while sleeping in his personal vehicle between shifts but he is expected to fully recover

SUMMARY: Two people who burned a part of Key West’s famous Southernmost Point buoy.

TITLE: 2021 ends as Chicago's deadliest year in a quarter century
SUMMARY: The year 2021 ended as one of the deadliest on record in recent years in Chicago

TITLE: Illinois woman in custody in killing of cop, wounding of 2nd

TITLE: Video: Zoo tiger shot while biting man's arm as he screams
SUMMARY: Body camera footage released by authorities showed a man screaming in pain and pleading for help just before a sheriff’s deputy shot a Malayan tiger that had grabbed the man’s arm at a Florida zoo

TITLE: Report paints grim picture of Chicago-area gun deaths
SUMMARY: Officials say more people were shot to death in Chicago and surrounding Cook County in 2021 than in any other year on record

TITLE: Magistrate recommends against tossing case against sheriff
SUMMARY: A federal magistrate judge has recommended against dismissing an indictment accusing an Atlanta-area sheriff of violating the civil rights of people in his custody

SUMMARY: The arts industry has been battered during the past 21 months, as organizations furloughed staff, canceled shows and slashed their budgets to weather the COVID-19 pandemic

TITLE: 1 arrested in Mall of America shooting in Minnesota
SUMMARY: Police say a Minnesota man suspected of having a role in last week’s shooting at the Mall of America that left two people wounded has been arrested

TITLE: Activists seek special prosecutor in teen's custody death
SUMMARY: A coalition of community groups is demanding that a special prosecutor be appointed in the case of a Black youth who died following a physical altercation with staff at a Kansas juvenile center

TITLE: Baby abandoned in box on frigid Alaska street corner
SUMMARY: Alaska State Troopers say a newborn baby was found abandoned in a cardboard box at a Fairbanks-area intersection, with a note indicating the child’s parent could not care for them

TITLE: Family of boy who died after restraint at center settle suit
SUMMARY: The family of a 16-year-old boy who was restrained at a shuttered western Michigan youth center and died two days later of cardiac arrest has settled a second wrongful death lawsuit in the case

TITLE: Mother's ex-boyfriend indicted in West Texas teen's death

SUMMARY: The body of a 75-year-old man has been found in Hawaii Volcanoes National Park after he apparently fell from a closed area late Sunday night on Hawaii's Big Island

SUMMARY: Three people were killed and another person is in critical condition after a vehicle crashed in the back of a snowplow in Maryland on Monday evening

SUMMARY: Hundreds of motorists spent a chilly night snowed in along on Interstate 95 after a crash involving six tractor-trailers in Virginia

TITLE: US manufacturing activity slows to 11-month low in December
SUMMARY: Growth in U.S. manufacturing slowed in December to an 11-month low as companies continued to combat supply chain problems

TITLE: A record 4.5 million Americans quit their jobs in November
SUMMARY: A record 4.5 million American workers quit their jobs in November, a sign of confidence and more evidence that the U.S. job market is bouncing back strongly from last year’s coronavirus recession

SUMMARY: It was a healthy year for big gifts to charitable causes in 2021, a year that saw one of the largest multibillion-dollar contributions in more than a decade, according to a Chronicle of Philanthropy tally

TITLE: Woman says police fatally shot her husband without warning

TITLE: Police boot protesters from Florida Gov. DeSantis' briefing
SUMMARY: Police in Florida have removed a handful of community activists from a news conference with Gov. Ron DeSantis after the group demanded to challenge the governor’s coronavirus policies

TITLE: 1st woman to command USS Constitution, aka Old Ironsides
SUMMARY: A woman is taking over as the U.S.S

TITLE: Muslim woman sues Missouri gun shop over hijab removal rule
SUMMARY: A federal lawsuit alleges that a Missouri firearms store and gun range refused to let a Muslim woman use a shooting range unless she removed her hijab

TITLE: Florida passenger train line kills 5th person in a month
SUMMARY: A Brightline higher-speed train fatally struck a pedestrian who walked into its path Tuesday, the fifth death involving the railroad since it recently resumed operations after being shut down because of the pandemic

TITLE: Church shooting survivor gives scholarships to prison nurses
SUMMARY: One of the survivors of a racist massacre at an African American church in South Carolina has started giving out scholarships from her foundation to students who want to provide health care to prisoners

TITLE: Albania, Brazil, Gabon, Ghana ,UAE join Security Council
SUMMARY: The U.N. Security Council has five new members

TITLE: Lawyer: Texas dad didn't know son accused in deaths had gun
SUMMARY: An attorney for a man accused of driving his son to a Dallas-area gas station store where the 14-year-old is accused of fatally shooting three teens and wounding a fourth says the father didn’t know his son had a gun
